title: HIGH SCHOOL SOFTBALL: Alexander Central claims 3A state title with finals sweep
content: GREENSBORO—Alexander Central rallied for three runs in the top of the seventh to force extra innings Saturday and then added two in the top of the 11th to complete the two-game sweep of Cleveland and capture the 3A state championship.      Chesney Millsaps finished 3 for 6 with two RBIs in Game 2, and she also went the distance in the circle to earn the pitching win. Only one of the Rams’ four runs were earned. They had nine hits. Millsaps struck out three.      Julie Gast also finished 3 for 6, and she drove in a run. Alexis Walter recorded two RBIs, and Alexa Rash went 2 for 4. That trio each delivered a double.      Alexander Central (28-5) seized a 1-0 series lead Friday with a 2-0 victory. The Cougars scored twice in the fifth inning.             Mattie Starnes and Walter recorded the only two hits against Cleveland pitcher Julia Wiggs. Starnes drove in a run.      Millsaps picked up the pitching win. She tossed a three-hitter and struck out three.      Cleveland finished the season 2
